From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To define the generation of the parity bit for the current terminal line and session, use the **terminalÂ parity** command in EXEC mode.
CLIs: terminal parity { none | even | odd | space | mark }

ParaDef.Info: No parity. This is the default.

Examples: In the following example, odd parity checking is enabled for the current session:
ExtraInfo: Communication protocols provided by devices such as terminals and modems will sometimes require a specific parity bit setting. Refer to the documentation for your device to determine required parity settings.

RelatedCmds.description: Defines generation of a parity bit for connections on a specified line or lines.
